sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"烘，烤"之意。
means: bake ： 指在烤炉里，烘烤，不与火直接接触，用持续的干热，缓慢地烘烤任何食物。
roast ： 一般指在火上烤大块的肉或整只牲畜或家禽。
toast ： 侧重通过烘烤使烘烤之物变成褐色，尤指烘面包、熏肉等。

sentence.Network_en: Steve uncorked bottles of champagne to toast the achievement.

sentence.Network_en: He rounds off by proposing a toast to the attendants.
sentence.Network_cn: 他向来宾祝酒，圆满结束了活动。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'burn as the sun does, parch'): from Old French toster 'roast', from Latin torrere 'parch'. The practice of drinking a toast (sense 2) goes back to the late 17th cent., and originated in naming a lady whose health the company was requested to drink, the idea being that the lady's name flavoured the drink like the pieces of spiced toast that were formerly placed in drinks such as wine
late 20th cent.: perhaps the same word as toast

encyclopedia.content: 英国电影<toast>基本资料 中文名：吐司 英文名：Toast 发行年：2010 年 国家：英国 语言：英语 片长：89 分钟 分类：传记/剧情/喜剧 导演：S.J. Clarkson 编剧： 李·哈尔 / 奈杰尔·斯莱特 主演： 海伦娜·邦汉·卡特 / 弗莱迪·海默 / 马修·麦克诺提 / 奥斯卡·肯尼迪 / 维多利亚·哈密尔顿 / 科林·普罗克特 / 肯·斯托特 / 弗雷齐尔·哈克尔 / 起亚·佩格 / 瑞利·纽博德 / 罗杰·沃克 电影改编自英国获奖图书《吐司：

entry.def: Toast is bread which has been cut into slices and made brown and crisp by cooking at a high temperature.
When you toast something such as bread, you cook it at a high temperature so that it becomes brown and crisp.

example.ex: Toast the bread lightly on both sides.

entry.def: When you drink a toast to someone or something, you drink some wine or another alcoholic drink as a symbolic gesture, in order to show your appreciation of them or to wish them success.

example.ex: Eleanor and I drank a toast to Miss Jacobs...
example.tran: 我和埃莉诺向雅各布斯小姐敬酒。

example.ex: At the end of the meal Burgoyne was asked to propose a toast.
example.tran: 用餐终了，伯戈因被邀请致祝酒词。

entry.def: When you toast someone or something, you drink a toast to them.

example.ex: Party officials and generals toasted his health...
example.tran: 政党官员与军队将领为他的健康举杯祝酒。

entry.tran: 深受敬慕的人;最受推崇的人
entry.def: If someone is the toast of a place, they are very popular and greatly admired there, because they have done something very successfully or well.

example.ex: She was the toast of Paris.
example.tran: 她是巴黎最受推崇的人。

entry.def: If someone is toast, you mean that they are certain to be defeated or destroyed.

example.ex: They know how to control, restrict and, if need be, throttle access, important to newspapers and absolutely vital to radio and television. And if you don't play the game, you're toast.
example.tran: 他们知道怎样控制、限制信息获取途径，而且如果需要，还会将其完全阻断，而这些途径对报纸来说很重要，对广播、电视更是极其关键。如果你不遵守游戏规则，你就完蛋了。

means.word_mean: 1. slices of bread that have been toasted
2. a celebrity who receives much accalim and attention;

sentences.sentence: "he was the toast of the town"

means.word_mean: 3. a person in desperate straits; someone doomed;

sentences.sentence: "I'm a goner if this plan doesn't work"

means.word_mean: 4. a drink in honor of or to the health of a person or event
1. make brown and crisp by heating;

I suggest to propose a toast to our friendship.

sentences.en: The old man was the toast of the whole neighbourhood.
sentences.cn: 这老人受到邻里的交口称赞。

sentences.en: She toasted slices of bread for refreshments.
sentences.cn: 她烤了几片面包当茶点。

sentences.en: I toasted the bread very dark.
Let's all toast the bride and bridegroom.
sentences.cn: 让我们为新郎新娘干杯。
